tracks.name: Bulk data
tracks.description: Participants in this track will test the FHIR Bulk Data Access Implementation Guide (IG) with a focus on new features added in version 1.1 (currently being balloted, previously called v1.5)

tracks.name: ONC FAST directory
tracks.description: Test aspects of the FAST Endpoint Directory Query.  This query is focused on providing specific metadata associated with the a FHIR endpoint.

tracks.name: ONC FAST Exchange
tracks.description: The purpose of this track is to test FHIR interactions across intermediaries as opposed to direct point to point interactions. In this track we'll test that we have the routing information embedded in the destination's public URL that we need to deliver and receive via FHIR.

tracks.name: ONC FAST Security
tracks.description: This track tests scalable ecosystem trust models used by FAST, Carequality, CARIN, and others. Focus is on security and privacy, including client app registration, authentication and authorization for cross-organization query, endpoint validation, and simple federated identity through reusable credentials.

tracks.name: PACIO Re-assessment Timepoints
tracks.description: The PACIO Re-assessment Timepoints Connectathon track covers a new IG that creates a definition for sub-periods of time within an extended post-acute admission. Since Post-Acute admissions can extend weeks, months, and years the "Re-assessment Timepoint" profile provides a way to break this information up into consumable blocks that can reflect the evolution of care over time in a Post Acute Admission.

tracks.name: Patient Access API - CARIN  Blue Button
tracks.description: Real-world testing of the CARIN Consumer Directed Payer Data Exchange (CARIN IG For Blue ButtonB.)

tracks.name: Patient Access API - Payer Data Exchange
tracks.description: A Da Vinci combined Track that covers the majority of Guides that address the CMS Patient Access API requirements of the Interoperability rule: Payer Data Exchange, Drug Formulary and Provider/Pharmacy Directory.

tracks.name: Payer to Payer Data Exchange
tracks.description: A Da Vinci track that covers the Payer-to-Payer Data Exchange requirements of the CMS Interoperability rule that are covered in the Payer Data ExchangeIG.

tracks.name: Post-Acute FHIR Order (DME Orders)
tracks.description: This track focuses on FHIR based RESTFUL exchange of orders from an EHR to a supplier or supplier HIT (or Hub) and the ability to update the order after order fulfillment.

tracks.name: Provider Access and Burden Reduction
tracks.description: Continue the testing of the Implementation Guides, as well as Reference and vendor Implementations for electronic Prior Authorization ( Da Vinci CRD + DTR + PAS IGs)

tracks.name: Electronic Case Reporting
tracks.description: Electronic case reporting (eCR) is the automated generation and transmission of relevant health information from electronic health records to public health agencies for review and action.

tracks.name: Gravity SDOH Exchange
tracks.description: Test the Social Determinants of Health (SDOH) Clinical Care FHIR IG. The SDOH Clinical Care IG provides a framework for multiple SDOH domains.  The focus of this Connectathon track is 1) test the resources and exchange workflow in the balloted IG and 2) test the exchange workflow to and between other stakeholders.

tracks.name: Quality Reporting
tracks.description: Test the use of the Data Exchange for Quality Measures (DEQM) IG for quality measure and gaps in care reporting use cases using FHIR-based eCQMs

tracks.name: Quality Measures
tracks.description: Test the use of FHIR-based eCQMs in Quality Measurement programs. The focus will be to calculate measure outcomes and create measure reports for a measure or measures of interest.

tracks.name: Military and Veteran SDOH
tracks.description: This track is focused on the social determinants of health and risk factors associated with military service.

alert: This event is still under construction - feel free to play around, but any changes you enter will periodically be removed. When the sire goes live ( a week or so before the event) then you'll be able to make changes.
